entry.title: Northvolt Cloud Architecture blog post published with AWS

link.title: Northvolt Cloud Architecture blog post published with AWS

entry.summary: Two Northvolt colleagues and I have collaborated on a blog post that describes the high-level design of the Northvolt cloud environment in Amazon Web Services (AWS). We introduce the concept of Cloud Factory Modules and explain how they are used to design and build a scalable platform for multiple large connected factories. The full blog post is published as part of “AWS for Industries” and can be found here: Northvolt’s next-gen connected factory—a digital blueprint factory built from scratch.

entry.title: 10% of income to most effective charities

link.title: 10% of income to most effective charities

entry.summary: This month, January 2022, I have made the decision to donate 10% of my income (definition) to the most effective charities as defined by GiveWell research and data.

entry.title: Perspective published in Joule
entry.summary: I am delighted to have been part of a team writing a forward-looking Perspective on the future of data-driven Li-ion battery research with focus on improved safety. The Perspective was a collaboration with co-authors from NREL, MIT, Tsinghua, and Imperial College and is now available in the academic journal Joule. The full text can be accessed at The Application of Data-Driven Methods and Physics-Based Learning for Improving Battery Safety.

entry.title: Imperial College talk on Northvolt Giga-scale Li-ion manufacturing

link.title: Imperial College talk on Northvolt Giga-scale Li-ion manufacturing

entry.summary: On 10 December 2019 I was invited to Imperial College London to give a talk on Northvolt’s progress so far, and what’s in store for the future. The title was Giga-Scale European Li-ion Manufacture: Bold bets, deep analytics, sustainable by design. The session was jointly hosted by Energy Futures Lab and Dyson School of Design Engineering. The recording is now available on YouTube.

entry.title: Foo Café talk on Neural Network performance

link.title: Foo Café talk on Neural Network performance

entry.summary: On 9 May 2017 I was invited to Foo Café Malmö to give a second talk on Machine Learning for Self-Driving Cars. This talk builds upon the 20 April 2017 Behavioral Cloning talk and focuses on improving neural network performance. The recording is now available to watch on YouTube.
